subject: RE: [junit] JSObject
msgSnippet: Hi Eric, ... Can you describe exactly what you want to test and which JavaScript environment you use? Also *which* JsUnit did you consider? Xprogramming.com
messageBody:
Hi Eric,

> Has anyone written unit tests trying to use the
> netscape.javascript.JSObject? I've been poking around, but haven't
> found a good way to create one containing the values I want. Of
> course they would just *HAVE* to make it final, so I couldn't extend
> it. :p
>
> I have downloaded the latest JSUnit, so if that's the route I will
> have to take, just let me know. And, if you've used JSUnit to write
> tests for a class using JSObject, please drop me some hints. :)

Can you describe exactly what you want to test and which JavaScript
environment you use? Also *which* JsUnit did you consider? Xprogramming.com
lists 4 different.

Regards,
Jorg
